name: Diabetes, Physical Examination Details
description:
GENERAL - thin or obese
NEURO - check for sensation
NECK
CARDIO - murmur
LUNGS
ABDOMEN - renal bruits
EXTREMITIES - edema
SKIN - check for foot ulcuers
VISION cover each eye
Gross exam: (finger count etc)
NEW DIAGNOSTICS – SEE CHECKLIST
- lipids
- A1C
- Cr (then calculate GFR)

name: Diabetes, Assessment And Followup
description:
- Not at A1c goal –increase meds/add 2nd agent-> 2 weeks
- A1C at goal+clinic stable –> 3 months for A1C
- A1C at goal but comorbidity needs f/u (htn/hld etc) --> 1 month
MEDS
MAKE SURE PATIENT DOES NOT SKIP MEALS WHILE ON MED
- metformin
- sulfonuria / glimepiride
- insulin mixtard 30/70
- insulin regular
CHECKLIST
- Counsel smoking/diet/exercise
- A1C q3 months
- Screen lipids q12mo.goal LDL<100
- Cr q12mo, start ACE if protein+
- Foot ulcers, screen every visit
- Near+far visit vision every visit
- Slit lamp recommended Q12mo.
ER REFERRAL/ IPD admission
- DO NOT SEND VISIBLY SICK/UNSTABLE PT HOME
IF patient appears dehydrated, abdominal pain, lighteadedness, or diaphoretic. Consider HHS or DKA (check f/s gluc, urine ketones, give fluids).
